name: windows-ai-studio
displayName: AI Toolkit for Visual Studio Code
description: AI Toolkit for VS Code streamlines generative AI app development by integrating tools and models. Browse and download public and custom models; author, test and evaluate prompts; fine-tune; and use them in your applications.

windowsaistudio.tracingGrpcPort.description: The port to use for the OpenTelemetry OTLP gRPC receiver

windowsaistudio.tracingHttpPort.description: The port to use for the OpenTelemetry OTLP HTTP receiver

windowsaistudio.extendCopilotInstruction.description: Extend GitHub Copilot Chat instructions for better AI Toolkit tool uses.

windowsaistudio.enableRemoteFine-tuningA.description: Enable to run fine-tuning and inference on Azure Container Apps (Reload Visual Studio Code after changing this setting to take effect).

windowsaistudio.templateRef.description: Branch to pull from the template repo

windowsaistudio.openAIInferencePort.description: The Open AI inference http local port

displayName.description: Display Name used in the UI

windowsaistudio.externalOpenAIProviders.description: List of external providers to register

TypeName.description: Type Name of the external provider

ModelName.description: Name of the AI model to expose

BaseUri.description: The Base URI where the external provider receive http requests

windowsaistudio.modelLabAcceptedDatasets.description: User accepted datasets in Model Lab

windowsaistudio.modelLabGlobalCachePath.description: If set, use this global shared cache instead of per project in Model Lab

viewsWelcome.contents:
Get started with AI Toolkit: explore models or quickly build and test agents.
Start your exploration by [adding a model from catalog](https://aka.ms/AIToolkit/doc/models). You can start free with GitHub hosted model or use a more powerful model from Azure AI Foundry.
[Start with a FREE model on GitHub](command:ai-mlstudio.models?%7B%22initialProviderFilter%22%3A%20%22GitHub%22%7D)
[Use Enterprise Ready Model on AI Foundry](command:ai-mlstudio.models?%7B%22initialProviderFilter%22%3A%20%22Azure%20AI%20Foundry%22%7D)
Prefer to start building? [Create your AI apps or agents](http://aka.ms/aitoolkit/doc/agentbuilder) now and add models whenever you need.
[Open Agent Builder](command:ai-mlstudio.agentBuilder)
Visit [AI Toolkit documentation](http://aka.ms/aitoolkit/docs) for more features.

commands.title: AI Toolkit: Encrypt a value for custom model

requiredHost.description: The explicitly required host for the model or agent. DO NOT provide if not determined or just guess. 'GitHub' means to use GitHub-hosted models. 'AzureAIFoundry' means to use Azure AI Foundry-hosted models or agents. 'other' means none of above.

moreIntent.description: Additional intent of app development, e.g. 'create hello world agent', 'connect to my tools', 'make app agentic', etc.

preferredHost.description: Host preferences (NOT publisher) for the AI model. If preference not determined or matched, use empty array. Can have multiple preferences if needed.

currentModel.description: Current model you're using (if already using one)

moreIntent.description: Additional intent of model usage, e.g. 'ask for model choice', 'generate code', 'compare models', etc.

category.description: The category of the AI application development. 'Agent' means to build single agent or agentic app with complex capabilities. 'Workflow' or 'MultiAgents' means to orchestrate multiple agents or build as workflow. 'Chat' means to build simple chat with model.

host.description: The host for the model or agent. 'GitHub' means to use GitHub-hosted models. 'AzureAIFoundry' means to use Azure AI Foundry-hosted models or agents. 'other' means none of above. For workflow or multi-agents category, use 'AzureAIFoundry'.

language.description: The programming language of the AI application development.
The programming language of the AI application

sdk.description: The AI SDK used by the application, which impacts how tracing is implemented. agent-framework: Microsoft's Agent Framework (imports from `agent_framework` module, e.g., `from agent_framework.openai import OpenAIChatClient`). openai-agents: OpenAI's Agents SDK (imports from `agents` module, e.g., `from agents import Agent`).

isForVisualization.description: Optional parameter to indicate whether the tracing setup is primarily for multi-agents workflow visualization purposes.

evaluationMetrics.description: List of what you want to evaluate for your AI application or agent. ONLY include when the user explicitly describes specific evaluation goals, metrics with clear details (e.g., 'Evaluate if generated review text has a positive sentiment', 'check if responses contain specific keywords', 'validate JSON format'). Do NOT include for general requests like 'add evaluation' or 'evaluate my app' without specific requirements.

items.description: Description of what to evaluate and the goal (e.g., 'Response accuracy - check if answers are factually correct', 'Response relevance - assess how well responses address the user question', 'Response time - measure if responses are generated within acceptable time limits')

language.description: The programming language for the evaluation code
The programming language for the generated agent code. If not specified, Python is recommended.

sdk.description: The AI SDK used by the application.

languageModelChatProviders.displayName: Azure AI Foundry via AI Toolkit

chatAgents.name: AIAgentExpert
chatAgents.description: Expert in developing AI agent applications with best practices

scripts.package-linux-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --target linux-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-darwin-arm64: npm run set-version && vsce package --target darwin-arm64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-darwin-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --target darwin-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-win32-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --target win32-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-win32-arm64: npm run set-version && vsce package --target win32-arm64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-universal: npm run set-version && vsce package && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-linux-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release --target linux-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-darwin-arm64: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release --target darwin-arm64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-darwin-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release --target darwin-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-win32-x64: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release --target win32-x64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-win32-arm64: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release --target win32-arm64 && npm run reset-version
scripts.package-pre-release-universal: npm run set-version && vsce package --pre-release && npm run reset-version
scripts.test:unit: npm run download-template && npm run build:test && mocha
scripts.prepare-bin: npm run copy-workspace-agent && npm run copy-inference-agent
scripts.bootstrap-developer-win-arm64: npm run install:all && npm run build:webview && npm run build:model-lab && npm run build-workspace-agent-win-arm64 && npm run build-inference-agent-win-arm64 && npm run prepare-bin && npm run compile-development && npm run download-template
scripts.bootstrap-developer-win-x64: npm run install:all && npm run build:webview && npm run build:model-lab && npm run build-workspace-agent-win-x64 && npm run build-inference-agent-win-x64 && npm run prepare-bin && npm run compile-development && npm run download-template
scripts.bootstrap-developer-linux-x64: npm run install:all && npm run build:webview && npm run build:model-lab && npm run build-workspace-agent-linux-x64 && npm run build-inference-agent-linux-x64 && npm run prepare-bin && npm run compile-development && npm run download-template
scripts.install:all: npm install && cd webview-ui && npm install && cd ../model-lab-ui && npm install
scripts.build:model-lab: npm run prettier:model-lab && npm run sync:model-lab && cd model-lab-ui && npm run build
scripts.sync:model-lab: copyfiles -u 3 -V model-lab-ui/src/rpc/**/* src/model-lab/rpc && copyfiles -u 2 -V model-lab-ui/src/rpc/interface/model.ts model-lab-ui/uitests
scripts.prettier:model-lab: prettier --write model-lab-ui/src/**/*.ts model-lab-ui/src/**/*.tsx model-lab-ui/uitests/**/*.ts src/model-lab/**/*.ts tests/model-lab/**/*.ts
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-development && npm run lint && npm run download-template
scripts.download-template: npm run download-ai-studio-template && npm run download-chat-template
scripts.setup: npm run install:all && npm run compile-development && npm run build:webview
